newsitem.title: USA: U.S. late spot propane edges back up in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. late spot propane edges back up in slow trade.

text.p: U.S. late spot propane prices were higher in late trade on Tuesday after gaining strength on the short-lived rise of NYMEX November crude oil futures.
NYMEX November crude oil spiked in late afternoon trade on news of a catalytic cracker outage at the Amuay refiner in Venezuela before ending down 17 cents.
"Propane started running with NYMEX and stayed high," said one Houston trader.
Support also came from rumors that a major producer was short of propane and that many players are expecting bullish data in Wednesday's government inventory report.
In the U.S. Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu spot propane gained a quarter cent to between 53.25 cents and 53.50 cents a gallon, with TET spot trading for 54.00 cents.
Spot propane in the Midwest was traded a half cent higher at 53.00 cents after falling 0.75 cent earlier in the day.
Activity was light particulary in the Midwest due to industry functions that will take many players out of their offices until Wednesday afternoon.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
